[[.NET Framework]] | size = 51.75 MB ~ 93.93 MB | language = | genre = [[Device driver]] and [[system monitor]] | license = [[Freeware]] | website = {{URL|http://sites.amd.com/us/game/downloads/Pages/downloads.aspx}} }} '''AMD Catalyst''' (formerly named '''ATI Catalyst''') is a [[device driver]] and [[utility software]] package for [[ATI]] line of [[video card]]s. It runs on Microsoft Windows and Linux, on 32- and 64-bit x86 processors. == History == Catalyst was instituted on 13 June 2002[http://ati.amd.com/companyinfo/press/2002/4506.html ATI Catalyst announcement] with version 02.1 after the release of the Radeon 8500, as "a software suite that includes unified driver and software applications to enable [ATI's] Radeon family of graphics products" for [[Windows XP]], [[Windows 2000]] and [[Windows Me]], with support for [[Windows 98]] via the Windows Me driver. The first number in a release version denotes the year, the second the release within that year, starting at x.1 for all years other than 2003 when there was a 3.0 release. The original Catalyst consisted of these elements: #A new, unified driver for [[ATI Radeon]] graphics cards #Hydravision, ATI's proprietary desktop management software #An ATI "Multimedia Center" #ATI's Remote Wonder software #A new AGP diagnostic and stability tool #A newly redesigned control panel Key features promised by ATI include frequent driver updates with performance enhancements, bug fixes, and new features. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" ! It shows a small 3D preview and allows the user to see how changes to the graphics settings affects the quality of the rendered image. It also shows information about the card itself and the software data. This application requires Microsoft [[.NET Framework]]. === Linux === '''fglrx''' is the name of the [[Linux]] display driver used for ATI Radeon and [[ATI FireGL]] family of video adapters and stands for "FireGL and Radeon for [[X Window System|X]]". It contains both [[free and open-source]] and [[proprietary software|proprietary]] parts. Starting from Catalyst 11.7, the ATI Proprietary Linux driver was renamed ATI Catalyst Linux, and was moved to the same release dates and version numbering as the versions for Microsoft Windows.[http://www2.ati.com/drivers/linux/catalyst_711_linux.html ATI Catalyst Linux 7.11 release notes] Linux version has been criticized for its stability and performance issues as well as lack of options.[http://www.phoronix.com/vr.php?view=13267 AMD Linux 2008 Year in Review] on [[Phoronix]]. Mostly negative [http://www.phoronix.com/review2forums.php?view=amd_ayir_2008 forum response].[http://linux.slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=07/06/04/1532215 Insight Into AMD's Linux Driver Development (2007)][http://linux.slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=06/07/20/1433230 The State of ATI Drivers on GNU/Linux (2006)][http://linux.slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=05/07/30/197259 A Look at the State of ATI Linux Drivers (2005)] The state of the driver has improved over time with AMD trying to work in concert with application developers,[http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.emulators.wine.user/36669 WineD3D developer statement] concerning fglrx (2008-12) although for most instances the drivers are considered to be solid enough for most tasks and functional for most users.[http://xtrabuntu.blogspot.com/2011/02/overview-of-graphic-card-manufacturers.html An overview of graphic card manufacturers and how well they work with Ubuntu] Originally posted on Ubuntu Gamer, January 10, 2011 (Article by Luke Benstead) ==HydraVision== HydraVision is a desktop/screen management software mostly providing [[multi-monitor]] and virtual-screen management. Besides screen management, it includes hardware-accelerated eyefinity and has extensive hot-key support.[http://www.rage3d.com/reviews/software/catalyst/ ATi Catalyst Review] Ryan Ku, Rage3D.com, June 13, 2002, retrieved November 26, 2010. HydraVision was originally developed in late 90s by [[Appian Graphics]][http://web.archive.org/web/19990127160839/www.appiangraphics.com/product/hydra.htm Archived HydraVision web presentation] published Jan 25, 1999, retrieved November 26, 2010. for their multi-head display solutions. ATI acquired HydraVision in July 2001 along with Appian's HydraVision team to join its then-new dual-head [[Radeon R100#RV200|Radeon 7500]] and [[Radeon 8500|8500]] series. Currently it is an optional component of the Catalyst software suite.{{cite web |url=http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/windows/Pages/radeonmob_win7-64.aspx#3 |title=AMD Catalystâ¢ Display Driver |publisher=[[AMD]] |accessdate=2011-05-17}} ==Supported products== Not all platforms have an equal level of support. In general, AMD/ATI has also been praised for its Linux graphics work outside of its Catalyst driver support, including providing documentation and limited support, as well as some actual active development, to various free software drivers. This is in direct contrast to AMD's main competitor in the graphics field [[NVIDIA]], which does offer its own proprietary driver similar to Catalyst, but does not provide any support or assistance to any free graphics initiatives.[http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=NzgwNQ NVIDIA's Response To Recent Nouveau Work] [[Phoronix]], December 14, 2009 (Article by [[Michael Larabel]]) == See also == ;ATI video adapters *[[All-in-Wonder]] *[[Radeon]] *[[Comparison of ATI chipsets]] *[[Comparison of AMD chipsets]] ;Related technologies *[[ATI Avivo]] *[[ATI CrossFire]] *[[ATI PowerPlay]] ;Related topics *[[Graphics hardware and FOSS]] == References == {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.amd.com/us/products/technologies/amd-catalyst/Pages/catalyst.aspx AMD Catalyst Technology] *[http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/Pages/index.aspx AMD Graphics Drivers & Software] *[http://sites.amd.com/us/game/downloads/Pages/downloads.aspx AMD Game Driver Page] {{ATI}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Amd Catalyst}} [[Category:Device drivers]] [[Category:Advanced Micro Devices]] [[Category:ATI Technologies]] [[Category:Linux drivers]] [[Category:Third-party Linux kernel modules]] [[Category:X Window System]] [[ar:Ø¥Ù ØªÙ Ø¢Ù ÙØ§ØªØ§ÙÙØ³Øª]] [[cs:AMD VISION Engine Control Center]] [[de:AMD Catalyst]] [[ko:AMD ì¹´íë¦¬ì¤í¸]] [[ja:Catalyst Control Center]] [[pt:AMD Catalyst]] [[ru:ATI Catalyst]] [[fi:AMD Catalyst]]
